intro: Pfaffia iresinoides var. angustifolia, commonly known as curaçao root, is a perennial herb native to the Caribbean. It features a thick, fleshy rhizome that is the primary part used for its medicinal properties. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. This species is valued for its potential adaptogenic and anti-inflammatory compounds.
